intro: Alectra pedicularioides, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and meadows. Alectra pedicularioides is often found growing in sandy or loamy soils and is relatively easy to identify due to its distinctive appearance.
